title: Storm Surge: The Silent Killer
description: A quick win: understand Storm Surge: The Silent Killer.

hook.text: Storm surge kills more people in hurricanes than wind, rain, or tornadoes combined.

buildup.text: Low pressure and strong winds push ocean water inland, creating a dome of water ahead of the storm.

discovery.text: Surge heights can exceed 6 meters â€” enough to submerge entire coastal towns.

twist.text: Hurricane Katrina's surge reached 8.5 meters in Mississippi, flooding areas 10 km from the coast.

climax.text: Climate change is raising sea levels, giving every future surge a higher starting point.

punchline.text: The deadliest part of a hurricane isn't the wind. It's the water.
